lithium.summary: Lithium mining is water-intensive and polluting. Improper disposal risks chemical leakage into soil and water systems.

cobalt.summary: Cobalt extraction, often in the DRC, has major ethical and environmental issues. Toxic if not recycled properly.

plastic.summary: Plastic takes hundreds of years to degrade. Often ends up in landfills or oceans, contributing to microplastic pollution.

aluminum.summary: High carbon footprint due to energy-intensive smelting. Recyclable but costly to produce from raw materials.

glass.summary: Recyclable, but high energy use in melting and reprocessing. Often downcycled in practice.

copper.summary: Copper mining disrupts ecosystems. Recyclable, but often lost in electronics e-waste.

nickel.summary: Used in batteries. Nickel mining releases sulfur dioxide and other toxins into the environment.

polycarbonate.summary: A petroleum-based plastic, not biodegradable. Common in electronics, with limited recycling.

PVC.summary: Produces toxic chlorine-based chemicals when burned. Often non-recyclable.

lead.summary: Toxic heavy metal. Can contaminate water and soil. Proper e-waste disposal required.

gold.summary: Gold mining uses cyanide and mercury, causing serious ecological harm in developing regions.

rare earth.summary: Rare earth mining produces radioactive waste. High pollution footprint despite small material volumes.
